message.msgid: IP pool start address can not bigger than IP pool end address
message.msgstr: IP pool start address can not bigger than IP pool end address!
DHCP server can help distribute automatically the IP addresses for the clients, if you enable the router’s DHCP server, it will help you configure all your LAN computers’TCP/IP protocol.
IP address pool: Enter a start IP address and an end IP address to form a static assignment range.
Lease time: Assign lease time only when the computer or DHCP client requests.

DHCP client list displays the client’s IP address, MAC address, and host that are obtained from the router’s DHCP server. You can manually enter an IP and MAC address and convert it into static assignment.
Instructions: After you add or delete one item you must click the “OK” button to bring the changes into effect.
Note:You need to reboot the router after finishing.

message.msgid: not to enter 'notag' in the Remarks field
message.msgstr: not to enter 'notag' in the Remarks field

message.msgid: one rule must be entered when 'permit only' is selected
message.msgstr: one rule must be entered when 'permit only' is selected!
To benefit your further management to the computers in the LAN, you can control LAN computers’ access to the Internet by setting the IP segment. Please refer to the user guide for detailed usage.
Instructions: If you want to clear one configured item, select it and click the "Clear" button and then click "OK" to bring it into effect.
Forbid only: Only forbid the configured IP or IP segment to access the Internet.
Permit only: Only permit the configured IP or IP segment to access the Internet.
Note: When the time is set as 0:0~0:0,it means all time segments.
MAC address filter function enables you to control the LAN computers’ access to the Internet. Please refer to the user guide for detailed usage.
Instructions: If you want to clear one configured item, select it and click the "Clear" button and then click "OK" to bring it into effect.
Forbid only: Only forbid the configured MAC to access the Internet.
Permit only: Only permit the configured MAC to access the Internet.
Note: When the time is set as 0:0~0:0,it means all time segments.

To facilitate your management over LAN computers’ access to websites,you can block LAN computers from visiting certain websites by entering the website’s URL. Please refer to the user guide for detailed usage.
Instructions: If you want to clear one configured item, select it and click the "Clear" button and then click "OK" to bring it into effect.
Note: URL character string: Enter only one character string for each access policy. When the time is set as 0:0~0:0,it means all time segments.

message.msgid: Can not be at the same segment with LAN IP
message.msgstr: Can not be at the same segment with LAN IP!
This feature allows remotely managing the router through the Internet. To use this feature, please select "Enable" and then remotely manage the router via the specified port on the PC.
Port: the port number that can implement remote management.
IP address: the IP address of the computer on the Internet that can implement remote WEB management.

message.msgid: the length is not within the range
message.msgstr: the length is not within the range!

message.msgid: Reboot the router to bring the settings into effect ,reboot now
message.msgstr: Reboot the router to bring the settings into effect ,reboot now?

message.msgid: Reboot wireless module to bring the settings into effect ,reboot now
message.msgstr: Reboot wireless module to bring the settings into effect ,reboot now?

message.msgid: remarks can only consist of numbers ,letters and underlines
message.msgstr: remarks can only consist of numbers ,letters and underlines!

message.msgid: The MAC address belongs to reserved addresses, please re-enter
message.msgstr: The MAC address belongs to reserved addresses, please re-enter!

message.msgid: The MAC address belongs to multicast addresses, please re-enter
message.msgstr: The MAC address belongs to multicast addresses, please re-enter!
